# liquidcn — Liquid Glass Components for SvelteKit

> This file helps AI assistants understand the liquidcn component library.
> It is auto-generated by `npx @gstohl/liquidcn init`.

## Overview

liquidcn is a component library for SvelteKit with a liquid glass aesthetic (frosted blur, specular highlights, translucent layers). It uses Svelte 5 runes, bits-ui headless primitives, and Tailwind CSS v4.

## CLI

```bash
npx @gstohl/liquidcn init              # Initialize project with glass tokens
npx @gstohl/liquidcn add button        # Add one component
npx @gstohl/liquidcn add button card   # Add multiple
npx @gstohl/liquidcn add --all         # Add all 46 components
npx @gstohl/liquidcn list              # List available components
```

## Import Pattern

All components are imported from `$lib/components/ui/<name>`:

```svelte
<script>
  import { Button } from "$lib/components/ui/button";
  import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "$lib/components/ui/card";
  import { Dialog, DialogTrigger, DialogContent, DialogTitle } from "$lib/components/ui/dialog";
</script>
```

## Glass CSS Utility Classes

Use these Tailwind utility classes for glass styling:

- `glass` — Standard glass: 24px blur, 12% white bg, glass border + shadow with specular highlight
- `glass-heavy` — Heavy glass: 40px blur, 18% white bg, stronger border + shadow
- `glass-light` — Light glass: 16px blur, 8% white bg, subtle border + shadow
- `shadow-glass` / `shadow-glass-sm` / `shadow-glass-lg` / `shadow-glass-xl` — Glass shadow levels (all include inner specular highlight via inset shadow)

## Svelte 5 Conventions

- All components use `$props()` with destructuring
- Children use Svelte 5 snippets: `{#if children}{@render children()}{/if}`
- Bindable props use `$bindable()`: `let { value = $bindable() } = $props()`
- The `cn()` utility from `$lib/utils/cn` merges Tailwind classes (clsx + tailwind-merge)
- Every component accepts a `class` prop for custom styling

## Dependencies

- `bits-ui` — headless accessible primitives (Dialog, Popover, Select, Tabs, etc.)
- `@internationalized/date` — date handling for Calendar and DatePicker
- `class-variance-authority` — variant management for Button, Badge, Alert, Toggle
- `clsx` + `tailwind-merge` — class merging via the `cn()` utility
- `tailwindcss` v4 + `@tailwindcss/vite` — CSS framework with `@theme` tokens
